column1: #COVID19 isn't going away. Neither is the maternal mortality crisis.  Thank you to the 13 Members of Congress who cosponsored the Kira Johnson Act this week. #Momnibus  https://t.co/c0bppagHuC

Happy Birthday to President-elect @JoeBiden! I’m ready to work with your administration on improving higher education solving the hunger crisis expanding affordable housing and beating COVID-19. https://t.co/Yu7HAn3EE2

Thank you @RepMarciaFudge for joining as a cosponsor of the #LocalFarmerAct which targets pandemic aid directly to local and regional producers & markets with specific support built-in for farmers of color & minority-owned markets to help them weather the impacts of #COVID19. https://t.co/kVuGQjE0CA

It’s time to talk about the harrowing experience of being pregnant during COVID-19 and how to make it better - because neither this pandemic nor the maternal health crisis are going away. https://t.co/Zr6dVFglCz

Over 38000 pregnant women received a COVID-19 diagnosis in the U.S.  Pregnant women are more likely to be admitted to the ICU receive ventilation and are more likely to die.  If you won't wear a mask for yourself wear one for the moms. https://t.co/Ep1hCTo2Nc
This flash flooding is serious. North Carolina bridges are collapsing as we speak.  Between the flooding and COVID-19 please stay home today if you can. https://t.co/GWu9wNDo7y
If the shoe were on the other foot the Democratic Senate would have passed a COVID-19 relief package. https://t.co/7BZUtrxJxD

Yet again the Trump Administration is trying to sweep COVID-19 under the rug. That’s why @BobbyScott & I sent a letter to OSHA to resume the reporting of COVID-related workplace hospitalizations and fatalities. https://t.co/s7L42AEFZN

Out of an abundance of caution I took another COVID-19 test today and the results came back negative. My prayers as well as my actions in Congress continue to be with everyone suffering from the effects of this terrible pandemic.
Critical question from Forest Harper of @INROADS: Thousands of students aren’t using the technology they need to learn. How do we combat that during #COVID19? #DiversityInTech https://t.co/xkdc5doNHA

We’re assessing how COVID-19 has impacted #HBCUs students & the tech sector.   We’re having real talks about exciting advancements and lingering shortcomings of corporate America’s diversity and inclusion efforts. #DiversityInTech

The Trump Administration and Republicans’ failed response to COVID-19 has cost roughly 200000 American lives and resulted in 6.8 million cases. Instead of taking decisive action to help American families fight this pandemic Trump Republicans #FailThePeople.

These next two days will bring together countless business and HBCU leaders and the nearly 100-member HBCU Caucus for substantive dialogue about increasing and improving our partnerships with an added focus on addressing COVID-19’s impacts. #DiversityInTech

Ensuring universal health care. Beating COVID-19 ... and cancer. A green new deal for climate change.  We made it to the moon. We have to do these other things not because they are easy but because they are hard. https://t.co/s9A89QCyZ5

The coronavirus crisis is hitting state & local government hard – forcing many to make devastating cuts to public education. The #HeroesAct provides nearly $1 trillion in state & local relief to preserve funding for students and schools. #FamiliesFirst https://t.co/bFEjGhc79W

Farms operated by Black Indigenous and other farmers of color have been among those hardest hit by COVID-19. Many of these growers have seen their revenue decline dramatically because of the pandemic. That's why I introduced the Local Farmer Act. https://t.co/LMFiMXGh4v

What have Senate Republicans been up to for the past 100 days since the House passed the HEROES Act? A whole lot of nothing.  The Senate should go back to Washington and pass this critical COVID-19 relief bill. https://t.co/5bOzH3Ck6C
Tonight: Please join us at 6 PM to talk about the importance of the Census - and how important it is for North Carolina to Be Counted during COVID-19.  Register here: https://t.co/moOLL0ohfh

Housing affordability is one of the most important issues facing Charlotte and it has always been a focus of my legislative agenda. We're having an important conversation on housing during COVID-19 in under an hour. I hope you can join us!  Register here: https://t.co/ZsyzEXhOTH https://t.co/lrqQwiG9km
We're having an important conversation on housing during COVID-19 tonight. I hope you can join us!  Register here: https://t.co/ZsyzEXhOTH https://t.co/Xyo499PF7L
Join us on Wednesday to talk schools reopening during COVID-19. Sign up here: https://t.co/bH8iyjI75w https://t.co/iiRxuzYvqX

No person should go hungry and they definitely shouldn't go hungry because of COVID-19. Honored to work with @RepMarciaFudge @RepMcGovern @RepJahanaHayes @RepKimSchrier @RepAlLawsonJr and @RepJimmyPanetta  to fix that. https://t.co/fTKes9Cf8F

From COVID-19 to maternal health environmental issues have a direct relationship to the health and wellbeing of Black people.  When we center environmental justice in our work we center Black lives. https://t.co/TjXUls3C3m

The Coronavirus pandemic has exacerbated existing systemic racism in health care and health outcomes in the US revealing what many of us know: more work must be done in order to achieve a truly equitable society. https://t.co/BlyvUSAn7G

Since President Trump invoked the DPA the United States has added approximately 2000000 confirmed cases of COVID-19. Congress - and the American people - deserve to know what he's doing to keep the food supply chain safe. https://t.co/KkovK9DV8L
Here’s what we’ve been up to since the #coronavirus outbreak started: https://t.co/pj4x1zD0NU

We’ve been working hard on your behalf during COVID-19. We still have a long way to go to recover from this crisis but know that I am fighting every day to help Charlotte and Mecklenburg County residents recover. https://t.co/PMAPHciVHR

As our nation continues to confront the COVID-19 crisis this bill will create millions of good-paying jobs and equip our nation with the 21st century infrastructure critical to growing our economy and helping our communities prosper for decades to come. https://t.co/3p1KedG2Rt
Testing.  Testing.  Testing.  Proud to join @repmarkpocan on this letter calling on President Trump to act so we can get the COVID-19 tests we need. https://t.co/o0UEn8OrXN

Today under authority of the #FamiliesFirst Coronavirus Response Act @USDA is extending all currently active WIC waivers through September 30 for all WIC State agencies that choose to continue operations under such waivers.  These waivers were set to expire tomorrow.

La pandemia del COVID-19 ha impactado la salud y la economía de las mujeres y sus familias especialmente de las mujeres latinas y negras. Es momento de actuar. ¡El @SenateGOP debe aprobar el #HeroesAct ya!

The safety of our Aggies and our community should be the university’s most important priority. We know COVID-19 disproportionately affects Black Americans and that means it poses a disproportionate threat to our HBCUs. I fully support A&T’s decision to cancel GHOE. Aggie Pride! https://t.co/0Ynff3qbf4

Hunger isn’t going away during the COVID-19 crisis. We need to expand Pandemic EBT now so that school children aren’t left behind during the summer months - North Carolina kids are already falling behind. https://t.co/AlNuD2oRsx
Today’s @EdLaborCmte meeting on how COVID-19 impacts public education is streaming live - you can watch here: https://t.co/KaQX8BtzUo https://t.co/6gOLpgpkvb
Our local governments shouldn’t be increasing the risk of spreading COVID-19.   Let’s keep protests peaceful without unnecessary escalation. #BanChemicalAgents   https://t.co/KyHLdGNEI7

During yesterday’s Workforce Protections hearing I asked @OSHA_DOL's leader if the COVID-19 pandemic “presents a grave danger to workers.”  The leader of the federal agency responsible for the safety of U.S. workers refused to answer.   https://t.co/1GJbWzyAoa

At today’s committee hearing we found out that the federal agency in charge of protecting workers isn’t even tracking #coronavirus infections in the workplace.  @realDonaldTrump do you even know what your administration is (not) doing? https://t.co/Pn1yzPl627
Today I'm chairing a committee hearing on "Examining the Federal Government’s Actions to Protect Workers from COVID-19." You can watch live here: https://t.co/7h6JgVqijG

My statement on today’s horrific #coronavirus milestone.  Never forget that our country’s greatness is a muscle; to flex it in the future we must exercise it now to help those who are in need. https://t.co/Vc5j2G4cWJ
New Coronavirus Mask for today’s floor session. https://t.co/vd4PmcrMXO

Thank you to the @NCNationalGuard for packaging 2.6 million pounds of food transporting 3 million pounds of food and distributing 1.2 million meals during COVID-19.    (as well as distributing 1.2 million masks 1.5 million hand sanitizer bottles 540 thousand gloves & more PPE)

After everything they’ve done for us during this pandemic we should be there for them. Thousands of service members including more than 900 National Guard service members from the Tar Heel State have been activated to respond to COVID-19.  https://t.co/OtEe5SKDfG

The men and women working to protect us shouldn't spend Memorial Day worrying about their benefits. From floods and hurricanes to COVID-19 our National Guard is always ready and always there during a disaster.  https://t.co/qdcbVDN8wD

Access to the ballot is essential. With millions of Americans still at risk due to COVID-19 a well-resourced comprehensive vote by mail operation in every state is necessary to guarantee the right to vote. RT if you agree. https://t.co/iMaXhrGdPI

Thousands including more than 900 @NCNationalGuard members have been activated to respond to COVID-19. The Trump Administration's plan to terminate their deployments in the middle of a crisis is yet another irresponsible decision that will make it harder to fight the pandemic.

From floods and hurricanes to COVID-19 our @NationalGuard is always ready and always there during a disaster. After everything they’ve done for us during this pandemic we should be there for them; but President Trump's move threatens their benefits.  https://t.co/S0nElCN2sv
Additionally HCQ is a necessary treatment for people with Lupus RA and other conditions - and unproven for COVID-19. #LupusAwarenessMonth https://t.co/rr0Mcyv4mC

During Asian Pacific American Heritage Month it’s more important than ever to stand in solidarity with the #AAPI community and denounce the alarming rise in anti-Asian bigotry we are seeing due to #COVID19. This is unacceptable and must end. #StopAAPIHate #APAHM2020 https://t.co/EDqFdRgIy5

Remember many of the people who are attacking the #HEROESAct are the same people who voted against the free COVID-19 testing and support for state unemployment insurance departments in #FamiliesFirst.

Workers face increased danger to their health and well-being due to COVID-19. As chair of Workforce Protections I'm doing everything I can to address the worker safety crisis.  The most important action we can take immediately is to pass the #HEROESAct! https://t.co/nbPNyJW4VQ

Fed Chair Jerome Powell - a Trump appointee - warned today that the US economy will experience “longer-term concerns” if Congress fails to address risks of a prolonged recession in the wake of COVID-19. Republicans including @realDonaldTrump should support the #HEROESAct

Many Republican members of the delegation said that they didn't support the #HEROESAct the COVID-19 relief proposal in front of the House right now. They said they wouldn't vote for the bill and they hadn't read the bill. #NCCOVID19

Last night I participated in an hour-long Town Hall discussion about the Coronavirus response with members of your North Carolina Congressional Delegation on @FOX46News. You can watch it here: https://t.co/CRYCzAr4Ej
Glad to join @GKButterfield @RepGregMurphy @RepDavidEPrice @RepMarkWalker @RepRichHudson @RepDanBishop & @RepTedBudd for tonight’s #NCCOVID19 town hall. https://t.co/Gu9BI653uQ

I'll be joining all of the Democrats and most of the Republicans in the North Carolina Congressional Delegation at 7:00 PM on @FOX46News for a Town Hall about COVID-19 and our Congressional response. You can watch on your TV or online here: https://t.co/NPiirLeXn6

Today I introduced a bill to address childhood hunger and support for school meals during COVID-19. I am honored that the language of my bill is included in the #HEROESAct pandemic package. https://t.co/HdtyiLcNa6

Our team read @Tesla’s return to work playbook (https://t.co/QSfObKZgzG) and it could be clearer about paid sick leave that can be used for COVID-19 @elonmusk. Here’s why that’s troubling: https://t.co/z0yeQEIkpi

As the chair of Workforce Protections in the House I’m genuinely curious Elon: what steps are you taking to protect workers and stop the spread of COVID-19 as you restart production? https://t.co/miRxIJgOVO
I'm about to be on @cspan's Washington Journal to talk about how COVID-19 has affected North Carolina - you can watch live at: https://t.co/T8kT9QCPMM

Why do we need to #CancelStudentDebt?   Student loan debt kills jobs. Black and brown borrowers bear the brunt of our $1.6 trillion student loan debt crisis. #COVID19 has made it worse.  @Ilhan @RepPressley and many other members of Congress are ready to fix that. https://t.co/tYushP6DaW

Answer: All of the Above. I'm proud to lead with @IlhanMN & @AyannaPressley this proposal to cancel student loan debt in the next COVID-19 relief bill. Cancelling student loan debt will create jobs relieve economic stress and grow the economy. https://t.co/R3FbbHBIqJ

As students across the country face disruptions stress and anxiety due to COVID-19 the need for this legislation grows increasingly clear. I'm proud to introduce the Eating Disorders Prevention in Schools Act of 2020 with @RepHartzler. https://t.co/qyusSrUSKG

Neither snow nor rain nor heat nor COVID-19 stays these couriers from the swift completion of their appointed rounds.  @USPS and its essential employees deserve the strongest possible relief in the next COVID-19 bill. #USPostalService https://t.co/S3hTNoCrJy

Nurses are on the frontlines of the COVID-19 Crisis. On #NationalNursesDay I'm thankful for nurses in Charlotte and throughout the country for putting themselves in harm's way to save lives and I'm proud to be a sponsor of the National Nurses Week resolution. #ThankYouNurses

Speaking with @MattGrantFOX46 from @fox46charlotte and Chris Barbeau a local small business owner in the trucking industry on how the COVID-19 crisis is affecting his business. https://t.co/ISpPpmufE9

Donald Trump desperately wants the COVID-19 crisis to be in the past - we all do.  However the American people continue to suffer from his Administration's response.   Like scripture tells us "faith without works is dead." https://t.co/31uVQ0qQXd

Our office has been working around the clock on food security during COVID-19. because we should live in a country where it’s impossible for children to go hungry. #SNAPMatters  https://t.co/7KKNnGT3VT

When the #NCGA reconvenes this week we can’t forget the hunger crisis.  When I asked House & Senate leadership to hold a special session on Coronavirus 45 days ago food security was a priority.  Now even more people are hungry.  We have to act.  https://t.co/hCEnVmB2hm https://t.co/sHbxXCYfli

This is frightening and immoral.  “In the age of Covid-19 when hospitals are operating near capacity the rule could also mean the life of a sick trans person is quite literally at the whim of a doctor’s personal beliefs about trans people.”  https://t.co/HFIhIXiHdT

I want you to know why I voted in favor of #CoronavirusRelief yesterday: emergency funding for our hospitals expanded coronavirus testing and more opportunity for our small and minority-owned businesses. https://t.co/ODgQoX4GKF

I've joined people living with Lupus arthritis and other diseases to highlight what life is like #WithoutMyHCQ.   Now FDA guidance is as clear as day: “Hydroxychloroquine and chloroquine have not been shown to be safe and effective for treating or preventing COVID-19.” https://t.co/rING0ciLQI

I introduced the "COVID-19 Every Worker Protection Act" because @WholeFoods and other retail employees need more than a T-Shirt - they need all workplaces to implement infectious disease exposure control plans. Period. https://t.co/6RCwJZMDXh

I just cast a vote to replenish the PPP fund and make sure that small- micro- women-owned and minority-owned businesses have the resources that they - and their employees - need during COVID-19.  https://t.co/ljFvanRZMt

Thanks @SenSanders @SenGillibrand & @SenKamalaHarris for introducing the Closing the Meal Gap Act a bill I originally introduced to open up SNAP to more people & increases benefits.  No one should ever go hungry in America especially during COVID-19.  https://t.co/jNT8jSzixK

Dr. Bright was right.  Lupus patients and hundreds of thousands of others can't live #WithoutMyHCQ. There is no conclusive proof HCQ is the right drug for COVID-19 patients and increasing evidence it is the wrong drug.

As Vice Chair of the @HouseAgDems and long before I was in Congress I've believed in words and deeds that #SNAPMatters.  Yesterday 72 Members of Congress joined my letter to the @USDA asking for the Secretary to extend SNAP during the COVID-19 crisis. https://t.co/ZPqJdZ8wBX

A constituent just called my office and asked me to tell @NC_Governor to continue the #StayHome order because it has flattened the curve.   I agree. Social distancing works and we can count on Governor Cooper to make a science-based decision on reopening NC during COVID-19.

This news is disturbing. Coronavirus patients who took HCQ died at a greater rate than patients who didn’t.  Hundreds of thousands of Americans are saying they can’t live #WithoutMyHCQ. We should listen to them not junk science. https://t.co/NVKLyKZqBD
Talking to @TimBoyumTV on @NCCapTonight at 7 PM tonight about the Paycheck Protection Program the Coronavirus and COVID-19’s disproportionate effect on Black Americans. https://t.co/b5QZTgyA60

In 10 minutes I'll be joining a Zoom call hosted by @NYUniversity titled "Why Pandemics Discriminate: COVID-19's Disproportionate Toll on the African American Community."  You can join here: https://t.co/UaXfrKBA4O

I'll be on @WFAE's @CharlotteTalks at 9:00 AM to talk Coronavirus and #BlackMaternalHealthWeek. I'll be joined by @DrPamOliver from @NovantHealth.   In Charlotte you can tune in at 90.7 FM or you can listen online from anywhere at https://t.co/nfRlQKkNGG. https://t.co/3z5Q2lGcfA

Tomorrow I’ll be on @CharlotteTalks to discuss the federal response to COVID-19 and the Black Maternal Health crisis. Tune in at 9:00 AM at 90.7 FM in Charlotte at @WFAE online or wherever you get your podcasts. #BlackMaternalHealthWeek https://t.co/3z5Q2lGcfA
Make sure you get your COVID-19 stimulus check from the CARES Act: check below:  https://t.co/cMj2JhqVDM

While our office staff is still hard at work our physical office is closed during COVID-19 and now due to this tree. Thankfully no one was in our office at the time the tree fell.   If you need assistance from our team we are happy to help at https://t.co/DQICwjWipa https://t.co/Q87Vm6mDFj

#BlackMaternalHealthWeek starts today and in addition to the disparities in maternal health our community is faced with the reality that COVID-19 is killing a disproportionate number of African Americans.   Join us for an urgent Symposium on Thursday: https://t.co/LwWy394bGG https://t.co/Q2dqOCxR7T

That’s why next week on Thursday April 16 our office is hosting a Women’s Symposium on Black Maternal Health: The State of Black Maternal Health During COVID-19.  You can register for the event here: https://t.co/mezWBpqVEE

Coronavirus is affecting all women. As maternity wards close to guests moms no longer have as many advocates when they give birth. Because of the economic and public health hardships from the pandemic women have fewer resources for prenatal care.
Now with the COVID-19 pandemic disrupting everyday life Black maternal health is even more important since a disproportionate number of African Americans are dying as a result of the coronavirus.

The economy lost 701000 jobs in March. We need a fourth bill to address the Coronavirus crisis because the American people deserve a continued coordinated fully-funded whole-of-government response to keep them safe from the health and economic impacts of the pandemic.
I’m on a Zoom call about the Coronavirus with some of my constituents right now and it reminds me of the Brady Bunch. https://t.co/PLVLo1tjbl

Has your business suspended operation because of limited commerce due to COVID-19? An #IRS credit may help you keep your employees on your payroll.  See FAQs on the Employee Retention Credit at https://t.co/gIZgMvNSV0 #COVIDreliefIRS
Food insecurity is a reality for too many people in North Carolina as we fight the coronavirus.  Learn more about the resources available to you and your loved ones here: https://t.co/eaKx5fUd4u

Today is #EqualPayDay.  Women lose an average of $10000+ to the wage gap each year - the equivalent of several months of rent.  Amidst the coronavirus pandemic too many families are scrambling to be able to pay rent tomorrow - and it's even worse for women of color. https://t.co/G1ZUKWQulK

On #NationalDoctorsDay I’d like to thank everyone on the front lines of the coronavirus crisis. From the doctors putting themselves at risk to provide critical care to the public health officials who our guiding our response  Thank You.

I’m saddened to hear of the passing of the first Mecklenburg resident from the coronavirus. My prayers are with their family and all of the families that have lost loved ones to this virus.  Today’s victim contracted the virus from community spread.   Stop the spread: stay home.
If you need to get in touch with us about the pandemic or get help with your coronavirus benefits please reach out here: https://t.co/mIDbc8hAZo

Both red states and blue states have expanded Medicaid. The coronavirus crisis has demonstrated that it's no longer a partisan issue.   North Carolina should have done it a long time ago. https://t.co/aFTDuU0cA9

President Trump has declared that a Major Disaster exists in the State of North Carolina due to the coronavirus. This declaration means North Carolinians can now apply for disaster unemployment insurance.  Thank you to everyone who joined us in calling for the President to act. https://t.co/LasOrFzp2z
Listen up Charlotte! @MeckCounty has issued a stay-at-home order.  Please take the coronavirus seriously and keep yourself and your family safe. https://t.co/rIb4xQOpR3

I'm hosting a TeleTown Hall in one hour to connect you with programs that can provide help and support during the coronavirus pandemic. Participants will be able to ask questions during a Q&A portion of the call.   Join by calling (855) 756-7520;57567# at 6PM. https://t.co/bYGWAyKFF7

I'm hosting a TeleTown Hall at 6:00 PM tonight to connect you with programs that can provide help and support during the coronavirus pandemic. Participants will be able to ask questions during a Q&A portion of the call.   Join by calling (855) 756-7520;57567# at 6PM. https://t.co/o8sNgCuO58
Any coronavirus legislation that moves forward to the president’s desk should take care of our small businesses our self-employed workers our gig workers and our families. #toosmalltofail

I sent a letter to House leaders asking them to prioritize the arts and cultural sectors - and especially their employees - in our next coronavirus relief package. Before bailing out billion-dollar corporations let’s support that which makes us human. #Relief4Charities https://t.co/zVGocZBYo4

I'm hosting a TeleTown Hall at 6:00 PM on Monday to connect you with programs that can provide help and support during the coronavirus pandemic. Participants will be able to ask questions during a Q&A portion of the call.   Join by calling (855) 756-7520;57567# at 6PM Monday. https://t.co/dcLfMkNNlo
Unemployed due to coronavirus? Don’t forget to check to see if you’re eligible for Disaster Unemployment Assistance:  https://t.co/koDn3L1vZq

Our office wants to make sure you have all of the resources you need to weather the coronavirus crisis. If you are a small business owner in need of an emergency loan the SBA has approved NC’s disaster status. Apply here: https://t.co/sooMbALxDj
Thank you Senators for passing #FamiliesFirst! Our second coronavirus relief bill now goes to the President’s desk. https://t.co/mswegIPzr4

Here's one reason why the Senate has to pass the #FamiliesFirst Coronavirus Response Act into law TODAY:  The bill includes essential child nutrition provisions that can't wait.  #FamiliesFirst creates a Pandemic EBT Program (P-EBT) that gives families emergency food assistance.

This is absolutely correct. House Republicans and Democrats came together to pass bipartisan legislation to help families weather this pandemic.  We need the Senate to take action on the #FamiliesFirst coronavirus bill now. https://t.co/xTmBy2qidi
If you have recently lost a job due to the coronavirus pandemic you can apply for unemployment benefits 24/7 online here: https://t.co/WByq2Ferw8

Today the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (@CDCgov) awarded $13.8 million to NC to support the COVID-19 response. The Coronavirus Preparedness and Response Supplemental Appropriations Act 2020 will award over $560 million in initial funding to states this week.

People are losing work pay and jobs due to coronavirus. No one should have to go hungry or lose their shelter due to this crisis. Federal state and local governments are working urgently to secure our health and well-being. The General Assembly should do the same. #NCGA https://t.co/UrFphutBhH
The safety of our students educators and school staff is paramount. Though they are challenging I support Gov. Cooper’s efforts to mitigate the spread of coronavirus. https://t.co/gQF6A63dLV

We fought for paid sick leave and secured that promise for families that need it.  However I want to reiterate that our response cannot stop here. People are already losing work hours pay and jobs because of coronavirus.

Our bipartisan #FamiliesFirst legislation is an important step forward for our federal response to the coronavirus. Our highest priority is mitigating the health and economic effects of this pandemic. Everyone who needs a test will be able to get one even the uninsured.

While we prepare to vote on #FamiliesFirst I want to take a moment to thank @SpeakerPelosi for her leadership during this crisis. Her work to get us a strong bill to fight coronavirus will help families and save lives.

Here’s why I’m voting for the #FamiliesFirst bill today:  ✅ Free coronavirus testing for everyone who needs a test including the uninsured  ✅ Paid emergency leave  ✅ Enhanced Unemployment Insurance  ✅ Strengthened food security initiatives  ✅ More federal funds for Medicaid

Today I asked NC General Assembly leaders for a 90 day moratorium on evictions foreclosures and water/utility shut offs. It’s a common-sense way to mitigate the health and economic effects of coronavirus.  Pandemics aren’t partisan issues. They’re life or death issues.

The coronavirus is a life or death crisis not a partisan crisis. That is why I have asked the leaders of the #NCGA to convene a special session and pass legislation that will provide immediate relief to NC families and mitigate the health and economic effects of the coronavirus. https://t.co/k8WGrPf0yy

We are hard at work to make sure that we mitigate the effects of coronavirus and keep North Carolinians safe from the health and economic effects of the pandemic but we need to make sure everyone has access to Emergency Family and Medical Leave. https://t.co/ZWYL9sQskW

✔️ Free #coronavirus testing ✔️ Paid emergency leave ✔️ Enhanced food security  This is how we confront the coronavirus public health crisis. Congress should pass the #FamiliesFirst Act today.   https://t.co/oJ3p25sJNw

When so many people are unable to forego a paycheck and stay home when they are sick an increased risk of infectious disease is inevitable. The Emergency Paid Leave Act is the least we can do to mitigate the spread of the coronavirus and help keep American families afloat.

At least one presumptive case of the COVID-19 novel coronavirus has been reported in Mecklenburg County. This is not a cause for panic but it reinforces the need for continued vigilance and prevention. Continue to wash your hands and promote good hygiene.

Since North Carolina has confirmed two COVID-19 cases I want to let you know our office is focused on impact of the coronavirus. As part of our response I voted to provide $8.3 billion for prevention vaccine research and assistance for small businesses impacted by the virus.

President Trump has taken his negligence to a new level. Not only has he disregarded the @CDCgov's warnings about the #coronavirus he's weakened our preparedness by failing to have individuals in place who can oversee a response in the event of a pandemic https://t.co/RxRzMOwvPP
